title: Hat and Clothing Box (Kwan-bok ham)
text: Korean craftsmen constructed special boxes for storing men's special dress clothing. This box would have held a ceremonial robe as well as a traditional hat (<I>kat<I>) made of lacquered horsehair.
description: Three levels, wide at bottom, thin at top; brass handles, hinges and diamond shapes (at edges); dark reddish stain; interior lined with paper
creditline: The Ellen and Fred Wells Fund
